items.content_html:
Summary

Chrome 133 supports the moveBefore() method: see https://chromestatus.com/feature/5135990159835136.

One feature addition that comes along with this method is a new lifecycle callback on custom elements â€” connectedMoveCallback(). This can be used to fix weird behavior that may occur as a result of connectedCallback() and disconnectedCallback() being called each time a custom element is moved to a different place in the DOM.

See https://pr39002.review.mdn.allizom.net/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/moveBefore#moving_custom_elements for more details.

This PR adds a data point for this callback.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: Chrome 133 custom element connectedMoveCallback() lifecycle callback support

items.content_html:
Safari 16.4 was the last browser to disable SVG Fonts, SVG Cursor, window.showModalDialog, <head profile="">, and <pre wrap="">.
Unshipping happened more than 2 years ago (March 27, 2023) and so this data is now considered irrelevant per our linter (see all the warnings on main). This PR removes the features altogether.
items.title: Remove features gone everywhere (last unshipped in Safari 16.4)

items.content_html: Fix #26397

items.content_html:
Moz are chasing standardization of Error.captureStackTrace() in https://github.com/tc39/proposal-error-capturestacktrace. It is only stage 1, but it was accepted as such. I think this means it is on the standards track?

Assuming so, added as spec url and this is now not "non standard".

If this merges here, will need to do minor updates to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Error/captureStackTrace

Related docs work can be tracked in mdn/content#38879
items.title: Error.captureStackTrace() - add standard/proposal

items.content_html:
I re-ran the collector for Chrome 135 release channel and the Observable API can now be observed as shipping :)

https://wicg.github.io/observable/
https://chromestatus.com/feature/5154593776599040
https://developer.chrome.com/release-notes/135#observable_api
items.title: Chrome 135 supports Observable API
